description: From Old French benevolent, borrowed from Latin benevolÄ“ns ("well wishing"). Displaced native Old English welwillende.

adjectives.description: benevolent (comparative more benevolent, superlative most benevolent)

entries.meaning: Having a disposition to do good.
examples: Chinese and Eastern mythologies describe dragons as benevolent.

entries.meaning: Possessing or manifesting love for mankind.
Altruistic, charitable, good, just and fair.
